snippet: The tombstone of Lee Harvey Oswald, the presumed assassin of President John F. Kennedy, is displayed in an Illinois automotive museum. A Texas family says it has rights to the piece.
abstract: David Card is determined to pursue whatever legal action it takes to get back original tombstone of Lee Oswald, the presumed assassin of John F Kennedy; Card family first stumbled upon the gravestone some 30 years ago in crawl space under Texas house of Oswald's mother Marguerite Oswald, which the family bought after she died; stone ended up in hands of his step-cousin's wife, who sold it two years ago, and is currently being displayed at Historic Automotive Attractions museum in Roscoe, Ill.
lead_paragraph: The tombstone of Lee Harvey Oswald, the presumed assassin of President John F. Kennedy, is displayed in an Illinois automotive museum. A Texas family says it has rights to the piece.

headline.seo: A Dispute Over Lee Harvey Oswald’s Tombstone
headline.main: A Macabre Tussle Over a Historic Slab
